Tá cur síos anseo ar thoghairmeacha
Legal representation in criminal cases
Ionadaíocht Dhleathach i gcás Coiriúil
Types of criminal offence and the role of your defence counsel in a criminal case in Ireland are described
Déantar cur síos anseo ar ionadaíocht dlhleathach i gcásanna coiriúla
Time limitations for the commencement of criminal proceedings
Teorainneacha ama chun imeachtaí coiriúla a thosú
Information on the time limits for the commencement of criminal proceedings in Ireland is provided
Tá cur síos anseo ar na téarmaí ama le tús a chur le cás coiriúil
An introduction to the various types of criminal trial that take place in Ireland
Déantar cur síos anseo ar an triail choiriúil agus cuirtear an rannóg seo i láthair
Disclosure in criminal cases
Nochtadh i gcásanna coiriúla
In a criminal trial the prosecution has a duty to disclose to the defence, in advance of the trial, all relevant evidence which it has
I dtriail choiriúil tá sé de dhualgas ag lucht an ionchúisimh an fhianaise ábhartha go léir atá acu a nochtadh don lucht cosanta roimh an triail
However, this duty can vary
Ach d'fhéadfadh an dualgas sin bheith éagsúil
Criminal insanity and mental health
Gealtacht choiriúil agus meabhairshláinte
The law regarding criminal insanity and mental health sets out rules on fitness to plead, diminished responsibility and the Mental Health Review Board
Leagann an dlí maidir le gealtacht choiriúil agus sláinte mheabhrach amach rialacha maidir le folláine a phléadáil, freagracht laghdaithe agus an Bord Athbhreithnithe Meabhair-Shláinte
Sentencing at criminal trials in Ireland
Gearradh pionóis ag trialacha coiriúla in Éirinn
Where a court in Ireland has found you guilty of an offence or you have pleaded guilty, the judge will decide on your sentence
Tá cur síos anseo ar na rialacha a bhaineann le breith a thabhairt ar choirpigh ciontaithe
There are a range of sentences available to judges that can be imposed on someone found guilty of a criminal offence
Tá réimse leathan de phianbhreitheanna ar fáil do bhreithiúna ar féidir a ghearradh ar dhuine a fhaightear ciontach i gcion coiriúil
Maximum fines on summary conviction
Fíneálacha uasta ar ciontú achomair
There are 5 classes of maximum fine applying to summary convictions
Is ann do 5 aicme d’fhineáil uasta a bhaineann le ciontuithe achomair
Judges in courts in Ireland have the discretion to order offenders to make a donation to the Court Poor Box (i.e., make a donation to a charity in lieu of conviction)
Tá an chumhacht ag breithimh i gcúirteanna in Éirinn ordú a thabhairt do chiontóirí síntiús a dhéanamh do Bhosca na mBocht (is é sin, síntiús chuig carthanas a dhéanamh in áit a bheith ciontaithe)
The Drug Offenders Register was introduced by the Criminal Justice Act 2006 and is based on the same principle as the Sex Offenders Register
Tugadh Clár na gCiontóirí Drugaí isteach leis an Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006 agus tá sé bunaithe ar an bprionsabal céanna le Clár na gCiontóirí Gnéis
It enables the movements of convicted drug dealers to be recorded
Cuireann sé ar chumas na hÚdaráis gluaiseachtaí ciontaithe gáinneálaithe drugaí a thaifeadadh
Those who are convicted of certain sexual offences are obliged to provide certain information to the Gardaí including the address at which they are living following their release from prison

Tá oibleagáid ar dhaoine a chiontaítear as cionta áirithe gnéis faisnéis áirithe a chur ar fáil do na Gardaí, lena n-áirítear an seoladh ina mbeidh siad ina gcónaí i ndiaidh a scaoilte saor ón phríosún
This provision was introduced by the Sex Offenders Act 2001
Tugadh an fhoráil seo isteach leis an Acht um Chiontóirí Gnéis 2001
